column4: how do I tell if I have OpenGL direct rendering set up right? I have a ATI X1300 card, envy installed
in a normal X server, type "fglrxinfo" (without the quotes) in the Terminal
all that tells me is that I have OpenGL version string 2.0.6458 (8.36.5)
um, sorry, i said the wrong command
it is "glxinfo | grep rendering"
if everything is well and working, it should say: direct rendering: Yes
hrm
says "No"
for direct rendering
did you disable Composite in xorg.conf?
Xlib: extension "Xfree86-DRI" missing on display ";1.0"
I don't believe I did
uh, you are running glxinfo under Xgl, yes?
I think so
I installed compiz
if compiz would work then everything is well
weird that it would not come up then
under Xgl direct rendering would always be "no"
oh
so, if I want to run games with cedega do I have to turn it on?
not neccessarily
